shortdesc.ph: Video degradation preference when bandwidth is limited.
Video degradation preference settings when bandwidth is limited.

plentry.pd: (-1): Auto mode (default). The SDK automatically selects MAINTAIN_FRAMERATE, MAINTAIN_BALANCED, or MAINTAIN_RESOLUTION based on the video scenario to achieve optimal overall QoE.
(0): In bandwidth-limited encoding, prioritizes lowering frame rate to maintain resolution. Suitable for scenarios requiring high image quality.
(1): In bandwidth-limited encoding, prioritizes lowering resolution to maintain frame rate. Suitable for scenarios requiring smoothness and tolerating quality loss.

(2): In bandwidth-limited encoding, lowers both frame rate and resolution. Degradation is less than MAINTAIN_QUALITY and MAINTAIN_FRAMERATE, suitable for scenarios requiring both smoothness and quality. The resolution of the video sent may change. Remote users need to handle this. See for details and resolution suggestions.
(3): In bandwidth-limited encoding, prioritizes lowering frame rate to maintain resolution. Suitable for scenarios requiring high image quality.
(-1): (Default) Auto mode. The SDK automatically selects MAINTAIN_FRAMERATE, MAINTAIN_BALANCED, or MAINTAIN_RESOLUTION based on the video scenario to ensure optimal overall QoE.
(0): When bandwidth is limited, prioritizes maintaining resolution by reducing frame rate. Suitable for scenarios requiring high video quality.
(1): When bandwidth is limited, prioritizes maintaining frame rate by reducing resolution.

(2): When bandwidth is limited, reduces both frame rate and resolution. The degradation level is lower than MAINTAIN_QUALITY and MAINTAIN_FRAMERATE. Suitable for scenarios requiring both smoothness and video quality. The resolution of the video sent from the sender may change, and the remote user needs to handle this. See .
(3): When bandwidth is limited, prioritizes maintaining resolution by reducing frame rate. Suitable for scenarios requiring high video quality.
